sub_topic: Calculating the bond dissociation energy of a molecule
message_1: What is the bond dissociation energy of one of the C-H bonds in a methane (CH4) molecule?
message_2: The bond dissociation energy of one of the C-H bonds in a methane (CH4) molecule is approximately 439 kJ/mol (kilojoules per mole). This value represents the energy required to break one C-H bond in the molecule.
